function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Neglecting the impact of buildings on climate change, resources, and ecosystems","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Delay in changing national energy and building codes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Regulatory approaches directing attention away from underlying problems","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Regulation as a force against innovation and creativity","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Promotion of self-interested behavior by standard-based systems","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of emphasis on reducing adverse environmental impacts in building design","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Standardization leading to homogenized human experience and expectation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for the impact of building design on contagious disease propagation","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increasing human impacts from building practices","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Uncertainty in outcomes due to co-evolutionary dynamics of people, socio-cultural, and ecological systems","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate accommodation of regional distinctions and local ecosystems in green assessment methods","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited focus on understanding and engaging local ecosystems and their processes","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Tight time and budgetary constraints in building design","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Power dynamics dictating building outcomes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for socio-ecological system impact","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complex systems and uncertain environments can lead to unpredictable outcomes, including the propagation of contagious diseases.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Deployment of energy-intensive technologies","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Dissemination of design and development practices","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of synchronization between scientific representation and social meaning","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ambiguity and overlap in top-down and bottom-up approaches","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of clear distinction in the production of the built environment","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of political agreement and concerted action to reduce global ghgs","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Complexity in policy-making and implementation at different government levels","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Shift of power from central government to local communities","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Architects maintaining a passive, apolitical role within existing regulatory and professional norms","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Disparities in wealth and poverty and formal and informal urban development in the san diego-tijuana trans-border urban agglomeration","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of commitment to specific societal concerns or agendas by different levels of government federal, provincial, municipal","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inability to characterize the influence of regenerative and development practices within existing policy frameworks","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of engagement and interaction between design professionals, communities, and stakeholders in implementing regenerative practices","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate design for climate change adaptation in built environments","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for contagious disease propagation in built environments","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased risk of contagion due to close proximity and interaction of building inhabitants.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Substitution of human agency with automated intelligence may lead to reduced awareness and proactive behavior towards disease prevention.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Uncertain weather systems and resource availability may impact building design and infrastructure, influencing disease transmission dynamics.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of prioritization of public health concerns in design decisions","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Ineffective integration of natural systems into building construction","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of community involvement and connection to the built environment","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Climate change impacting social goals and built environment","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Complex systems comprehension and reductionist science","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of alignment between regenerative development and existing building governance","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Cultural resistance to new approaches","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inflexible boundaries and limits in building governance","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Boundaries and property lines defining and protecting private ownership can constrain the expansion of professional responsibilities and practices in the built environment, hindering the integration of cooperative networked infrastructure.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Resistance to living systems thinking and the additional up-front time needed to engage stakeholder input and commitment can impede the adoption of regenerative development and design practices.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inconsistency in the scale of projects that design professionals work on may hinder the implementation of regenerative aspirations and cooperative networked infrastructure integration.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases in built environment","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited experience and case studies in urban regenerative development","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Uncertainty in measuring success of regenerative development projects","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Diversity in social and economic equity, demographics, and proximity to services create spatial heterogeneity in urban and suburban areas, impacting disease propagation patterns.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Regenerative development and design may be unfeasible in complex urban situations due to social and political pressures, limiting the implementation of sustainable and health-promoting built environments.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"}]}
